Pogumni mladi primorski godbeniki
06 Nov 2019, 13:25 by Helena Gardina Filipčič

Regijski pihalni orkester Krasa in Brkinov je združil 80 najboljših godbenikov iz komenskega, sežanskega, divaškega in brkinskega pihalnega orkestra, starih od 13 do 30 let. Odličen vtis so napravili na mednarodnem tekmovanju pihalnih orkestrov najvišje težavnostne stopnje v avstrijskem Grafeneggu.



Foto: Elisabetta Tenze

GRAFENEGG > Zanesenjaška zamisel o združitvi najbolj izkušenih glasbenikov iz različnih domačih orkestrov v karseda kakovostni mladinski sestav za nastop na zahtevnem tekmovanju je po dveh letih zaživela ob podpori komenske, sežanske, divaške in hrpeljsko-kozinske občine.
Najvišja kategorija
Nosilka projekta je bila Glasbena šola Sežana, ki med svojimi nekdanjimi učenci in obenem godbeniki v tem letu ponosno beleži kar 13 študentov na več glasbenih akademijah. Povabljeni so bili v projektni pihalni orkester kot glasbeniki in mentorji mlajšim kolegom ter tako dobili priložnost za nov izziv prav v domačem okolju. Poleg načrtovanih aktivnosti “jim je treba pustiti tudi proste roke, da se sami organizirajo in si dokažejo, česa vsega so sposobni”, pravi dirigent Regijskega pihalnega orkestra Krasa in Brkinov Matija Tavčar, navdušen nad izredno zagnanostjo mladih orkestrašev in odlično mentorsko delo pri sekcijskih vajah. Časa za pripravo zahtevnih tekmovalnih skladb ni bilo veliko, zgolj dva meseca za nastop na tekmovanju najvišje težavnostne stopnje v Avditoriju Grafenegg v Spodnji Avstriji.
“Prijavilo se je enajst orkestrov, nastopilo pa šest. Odpovedali so zaradi bolezni ali ker se jim ni uspelo zadostno pripraviti,” pojasnjuje Walter Rescheneder, zvezni kapelnik Avstrijske zveze pihalnih orkestrov, organizatorja tekmovanja, in obenem predsednik žirije. Združeni kraško-brkinski sestav se je predstavil v hudi konkurenci petih avstrijskih orkestrov in navdušil z doživeto interpretacijo in visoko kakovostjo najmlajšega tekmujočega orkestra. “Presenečen sem, da zmore tako mlad orkester izvajati glasbena dela take težavnosti in na tako odlični tehnični ravni,” je povedal žirant Thomas Doss, cenjen avstrijski dirigent in skladatelj. Komisijo sta sestavljala še švicarska dirigentka Isabelle Ruf-Weber ter klarinetist Dunajskih filharmonikov in profesor na dunajski glasbeni univerzi Johann Hindler.
Ključno je povezovanje
Muzikalno barvit in tehnično na visoki ravni izpeljan nastop primorskega orkestra pod suvereno taktirko Matije Tavčarja je ugledna žirija ovrednotila s 83 točkami in nastop tudi pisno ovrednotila. “Samo s konstruktivno kritiko strokovnjakov lahko napredujemo,” pravi Tavčar. Pomanjkljivosti pri skupni igri orkestra, kot so vzdrževanje uravnotežene zvočnosti in prilagodljivost na akustiko nepoznane dvorane, lahko povežemo z manjšim naborom izkušenj in uigranosti mladega sestava s kratko dobo obstoja. Z zmago je v Grafeneggu slavil Sinfonisches Blasorkester iz Rieda s 30-letno tradicijo.
Regijski pihalni orkester Krasa in Brkinov je na odru dosegel svoj maksimum, zato so vsi zadovoljni in upravičeno ponosni. Poleg dragocenih glasbenih izkušenj pa je dodana vrednost zgodbe pogumnih “primorskih Martinov Krpanov v boju s cesarsko konjenico”, kot jih je posrečeno poimenoval eden od podpornikov, predvsem v zglednem duhu pove zovanja in sodelovanja ter spodbujanja mladih k razvoju lastnih potencialov.  


Med vračanjem so se štirje avtobusi orkestrašev in spremstva ustavili v Schönbrunnu na Dunaju. Foto: Regijski PO Krasa in Brkinov

Courageous young coastal musicians
06 Nov 2019, 13:25 by Helena Gardina Filipcic

The Karst and Brkini Regional Wind Orchestra brought together 80 of the best musicians from the Komen, Sežana, Divak and Brkini brass bands, ages 13-30. They made an excellent impression at the international competition of the highest performing wind orchestras in Grafenegg, Austria.



Photo by Elisabetta Tenze

GRAFENEGG> The idea of uniting the most experienced musicians from different domestic orchestras into the highest quality youth ensemble for participation in a demanding competition came to life after two years with the support of Komen, Sežana, Divača and Hrvoje-Kozina municipalities.
Highest category
The leader of the project was the Sežana Music School, which proudly enrolls 13 students at several music academies among its former students and musicians. They were invited to the project Wind Orchestra as musicians and mentors to their younger colleagues, giving them the opportunity to face a new challenge in their home environment. In addition to the planned activities, "they should also be left free to organize themselves and prove what they are capable of," says conductor of the Karst and Brkini Regional Wind Orchestra Matija Tavčar, impressed by the extraordinary dedication of young orchestras and excellent tutorial work in sectional exercises . There was not much time to prepare demanding competition songs, only two months to enter the competition of the highest difficulty level at the Grafenegg Auditorium in Lower Austria.
"Eleven orchestras have signed up and six have performed. They quit because of illness or because they failed to prepare sufficiently, ”explains Walter Rescheneder, federal chaplain of the Austrian Wind Orchestra Association, organizer of the competition, and chairman of the jury. The united Karst-Brkini band presented itself in the fierce competition of five Austrian orchestras and impressed with the experienced interpretation and high quality of the youngest competing orchestra. "I am surprised that such a young orchestra is able to perform such works with such difficulty and at such an excellent technical level," said guarantor Thomas Doss, an esteemed Austrian conductor and composer. The commission also consisted of the Swiss conductor Isabelle Ruf-Weber and the clarinetist of the Vienna Philharmonic and a professor at the Johann Hindler University of Music in Vienna.
Connecting is key
Musically colorful and technically high-level performance of the coastal orchestra under the sovereign tactic of Matija Tavčar, the distinguished jury evaluated the performance by 83 points and also evaluated the performance in writing. "Only through constructive criticism of experts can we advance," Tavčar says. Weaknesses in playing the orchestra together, such as maintaining a balanced sound level and being able to adapt to the acoustics of an unfamiliar ballroom, can be compounded by a smaller set of experiences and a young composition with a short lifespan. With his victory, he celebrated the Sinfonisches Blasorkester of Ried in Grafenegg with a 30-year tradition.
The Karst and Brkini Regional Wind Orchestra has reached their maximum, so everyone is happy and rightly proud. In addition to valuable musical experience, the story of the brave “coastal Martin Krpanov in the battle with the Imperial Cavalry”, as one of the supporters affectionately called it, is especially added, especially in the exemplary spirit of connection and cooperation and encouraging young people to develop their own potentials.


On their return, four orchestral buses and escorts stopped in Schönbrunn, Vienna. Photo: Regional PO of the Karst and Brkini
